description: From Hindi चाबुक (cābuk), Urdu چابک‎, from Classical Persian چابک‎ (čâbok, “quick, swift; horsewhip”).

entries.meaning: (now historical) A long whip formerly used as an instrument of punishment in India and parts of the Middle East.
examples: Shut your mouths and get back to work or I'll whip you with my own chabuk.
